definition[0]: one of 12 law courts in the US that deals with cases when people are not satisfied with the judgment given by a lower court
definition[1]: in the US, one of the federal or state law courts that makes decisions about criminal and CIVIL cases that have been decided by lower courts but where people are not happy about the decision made
example[0]: The 11th US Court of Appeals in Atlanta overturned a federal judgeâ€™s dismissal of a water pollution suit against the company.
